content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)::String
    # Define the code fence for Julia code blocks in markdown
    code_fence = "```julia"

    # Split the markdown string by lines
    md_lines = split(md, '\n')

    # Initialize an array to store the Julia code blocks
    julia_code_blocks = []

    # Initialize a flag to check if we are within a code block
    inside_code_block = false
    current_code_block = []

    # Iterate over the lines of the markdown document
    for line in md_lines
        # Check if the line is the start or end of a Julia code block
        if startswith(line, code_fence)
            if inside_code_block
                # If we're inside a code block, this is the end; add it to the list
                push!(julia_code_blocks, join(current_code_block, '\n'))
                current_code_block = []
            end
            # Flip the flag
            inside_code_block = !inside_code_block
        elseif inside_code_block
            # If we're inside a code block, add the line to the current code block
            push!(current_code_block, line)
        end
    end

    # If the last code block does not end with a code fence
    if !isempty(current_code_block)
        push!(julia_code_blocks, join(current_code_block, '\n'))
    end

    # Join all code blocks with a newline character and return
    join(julia_code_blocks, '\n')
end
```
